meanings.definition: To enroll as a member of a college or university.
meanings.sent1: She matriculated at the university last fall.
meanings.sent2: He matriculated into the college's engineering program.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to matriculate into the dog's exclusive club.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for learning matriculated her into a world of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: Matriculating into the prestigious university was a dream come true for him.

meanings.definition: To be admitted into a group or society.
meanings.sent1: They matriculated into the secret society with great excitement.
meanings.sent2: The new employee matriculated into the company culture seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to matriculate into the flamingo group.
meanings.sent4: His dedication and hard work matriculated him into the inner circle of friends.
meanings.sent5: Matriculating into the book club opened up a whole new world of literature for her.
